info.name: IT Adacademy - M11
info.description:
# BCN Activa
## IT Adacademy

### M11 Exercise - Spring Getting Starter
- Know the structure of the HTTP protocol
- Learn to use Postman
- Understand how to use dependency managers (Gradle / Maven)
- Use projects with standard spring structure
- Create HTTP requests of GET type with parameters

### PHASE 1
- Download Install Postman to your system. Make a GET request at https://restcountries.eu/rest/v2/lang/es. Dump the result to a JSON file and save it to a new project directory.
- Create a new collection in Postman and save the previous point request in it. Export the collection and save it in a new project directory.

### Phase 2
- Using the SpringBootInitialDemo project as a reference, create a GET request to "/" that returns a "HELLO WORLD" in response.
- Modify the previous request to accept one variable per path, which is a name, by constructing “Hello, <NAME>”

### Phase 3
- He creates in Postman three environments, "local", "development" and "pre-production". Assigns as local variable "localhost", "dev.domain.com" and "pre.domain.com" respectively.
- It also assigns the variable "port" to the "local" environment, setting the output port used by the microservice. Executes phase 2 requests using the IP and port variables created in the URL.
- Export a new collection with the created environments and save it in the project.
